Yes, understanding grammar can be one of the most challenging aspects of learning a new language. Here are some tips to improve your grammar skills:

1. Study grammar rules: Whether it's through a textbook, an online course, or a tutor, taking the time to study grammar rules can be helpful. By understanding the rules, you can better understand how to use the language in context. 

2. Practice grammar exercises: Doing grammar exercises can help you reinforce what you've learned and apply the grammar rules in practical situations. They can also help you identify areas that need improvement and target them specifically.

3. Read and analyze texts: Read texts and analyze how the grammar is used in context. You can also use a bilingual dictionary to help clarify any confusing or difficult passages.

4. Speak and practice: Try to use the grammar rules you've learned in practice. Speak with your partner or practice writing short paragraphs, so you can experiment with using the language and apply what you know.

5. Seek feedback: Ask your partner or a language tutor for feedback on your grammar. They can help correct mistakes and offer insights to help you improve.

Remember, mastering the grammar of a new language will take time and practice. Keep studying, practicing, and applying what you learn, and you'll see improvement over time.
